page.title: 02Little Burstead Church
page.content: The Church of St Mary the Virgin is 600m south of Little Burstead. It is built on high ground to give a good view of the land. To the south east, St Nicholas Church Laindon is clearly visible. The church is made of flint rendered with cement. The butresses supporting the walls are self-made bricks of uneven size. The spire consists of Essex bargeboards. The porch faces south. The eastern side of the church has an extension added in 1787. The evidence for this is tombstones built into the walls. The graveyard is well maintained. Stones date from 1726 and include the grave of Captain Kidd, a pirate. Most graves face south, and those on the west side contain many of the past vicars.
